data.title: Privacy Policy
data.text:
PRIVACY STATEMENT

Table of Contents of Privacy Statement

All images in this template are coming from Unsplash and Pexels. You are free to use them for personal & commercial use.

Scope

This Privacy Statement explains how we handle personally identifiable information you share with GHOSTWARP and other information we obtain from you through your access to and use of our Site.

Information Collection

You may use this Site to learn about our products and services without disclosing any personal information. We may at some points allow you to register with us by using other social networking sitesâ authentication options to create an account. We may also provide a more typical registration flow where you may be required to provide us with contact information, such as your first and last name, home, business and email addresses, telephone, mobile and facsimile numbers, type of business, and certain other information about you and your business.

On the Site, in addition to purchasing goods, you may be able to:

Participate in surveys, sweepstakes and other promotions (subject to relevant and applicable laws). If you choose to participate in these promotions, we may ask you for information such as your name, email address, postal address and telephone number.

Sign up to receive electronic newsletters and promotional emails from us and our Affiliates (as such term is defined below), including new ideas, special offers and event information. To sign up, we may ask you for information such as your name, email address, postal address, telephone number, age, gender, shopping preferences and email preferences.

Sign up to receive communications about our products and services through your mobile device by submitting your mobile telephone number or email address online or by texting us.

Submit employment information, such as a resume or curriculum vitae.

Submit comments and your name to blogs we may host on the Site.

Create an interactive account and connect to crypto wallets and similar utilities.

Create a wish list of products you want and share your list by email with friends and family. If you choose to share your list, we ask for your name and email address and the recipient's email address; this information is used only to email your list to your desired recipients.

If you communicate with us through the "Contact Us" link on the Site, we may ask you for information such as your name and your and/or your companyâs name, email address, zip code and telephone number.We and our third-party providers may also collect information by automated means, such as cookies, Web beacons and Web server logs through your interaction with and use of the Site and non-GHOSTWARP Web sites (âAutomated Interactionsâ), which usually does not reveal your specific identity or does not directly relate to an individual. Â Such information may include, but is not limited to, network routing information (where you came from), equipment information (browser type), your IP address (which may identify your general geographic location or company), and date and time, clickstream information (when each ENDSTATE Web page was visited and how much time was spent on the page), product use and application data, or general geo-location data. Â This information helps us estimate our audience size and usage patterns, store information about your preferences, speed up your searches and other functions, and recognize when you return to our Sites. Â

Although our and our third-party providersâ use of Automated Interactions may change over time as technology evolves, the descriptions set forth in our Cookie Notice are designed to provide you with additional detail about our current approach to information collected from Automated Interactions.

By accessing and using our Site, you consent to the storage of cookies, other local storage technologies, beacons and other information on your devices. You also consent to the access of such cookies, local storage technologies, beacons and information by us and by the third parties mentioned above and within the Cookie Notice and this Privacy Statement.

Icons

The icons in this template are from Remix Icons. You are free to use this font for personal & commercial use.

Other Ways We Collect Information

Wi-Fi Network Information: To connect your ENDSTATE product to our Sites, or to access your ENDSTATE product over the Internet from a computer, a smartphone or a tablet, you will need to connect it to your Wi-Fi network, and use a NFC chip to authenticate the goods, including on a mobile device. During setup, the ENDSTATE product will ask for your Wi-Fi network name (SSID) and password to connect to the Internet. It will save this information on the device, along with your IP address, so that you can access it and control it from your computer, smartphone or tablet, and so that it can communicate with our servers and download software updates. Once connected to your Wi-Fi network, your ENDSTATE product regularly sends the data described in this Privacy Statement (excluding your Wi-Fi password) to ENDSTATE to provide you with the applicable services.

Bluetooth data: Bluetooth-enabled ENDSTATE Products may broadcast an identifying signal wirelessly. This is used to connect with your Bluetooth-enabled devices (such as a smartphone or tablet) in order to deliver certain product features.

QR Codes: We may use QR codes in connection with certain products, promotions, contests and special events. If you scan our QR code, you may get an invitation on your mobile device to join our mailing list. To sign up, we ask you for information such as your name, mailing address, email address, telephone numbers, and age. We use the information to communicate with you about our products, services and promotions and as described in this Privacy Statement.

Publicly Available and Other Sources: We also may obtain information you have made publicly or lawfully available, such as, via social media posts, or information provided by third-party sources, such as marketing opt-in lists, data aggregators and our third-party providers. In addition, we may supplement information you give us via this Site with information from other sources, such as information validating your email address or other available information about you or your business. Â If we combine non-personally identifiable information with personal information, we will treat the combined information as personal information.

How We Use Information

GHOSTWARP uses the information we collect from you for the following purposes:

Provide products and services to you

Send you promotional materials and other communications

Communicate with you about, and administer your participation in, special events, contests, sweepstakes, programs, offers, surveys and market research

Provide advertisements to you about our products and services in accordance with this Privacy Statement

Tailor your use of the Site, marketing experience, and communications according to your preferences and our terms

Interact with you on third party social networks (ENDSTATEâs interactions with you on a third party social network would be subject to that network's privacy policies and terms of use)

Respond to your inquiries

To post testimonials

Create and manage your account

Communicate with our servers

Provide software updates

Operate, evaluate and improve our business (including developing new products and services; enhancing and improving our Site (for example, to facilitate navigation and the login process, avoid duplicate data entry, enhance security and keep track of shopping cart additions and information between sessions); managing our communications; analyzing our products and customer base; cross reference customer databases to identify common customers; performing data analytics; (including online advertising and e-mail marketing), and performing accounting, auditing and other internal functions)

Verify your identity

Contact or notify you if necessary

Protect the security or integrity of our Site and our business

Protect against, identify and prevent fraud and other unlawful activity, claims and other liabilities

In connection with a job application or inquiry, whether advertised on our Site or otherwise, you may provide us with information about yourself, such as a resume or curriculum vitae, and we may use such information for the purpose of employment consideration or to reply to your inquiry

Comply with and enforce applicable legal requirements, our Terms of Use, relevant industry standards, contractual obligations and our policies

We also may use the information in other ways for which we may provide specific notice at the time of collection.

In addition, we may use non-personally identifiable information we collect for any lawful purpose. If we are required to treat non-personally identifiable information as personal information under applicable law, then we will only use it in the same way that we are permitted to use and disclose personal information.

Information We Share

We do not sell or otherwise disclose personal information about you, except as described in the Privacy Statement. In addition, if you direct us to intentionally disclose your personal Information to a third-party, we may share information about you with such third-party(ies) for those partiesâ own purposes, such as to offer products or services that may interest you. For clarity, an âintentionalâ interaction occurs when you intend to interact with the third-party via one or more deliberate actions.

We also may share the information with our service providers who perform services on our behalf based on our instructions. These service providers are not authorized by us to use, retain or disclose the information except as necessary to perform services on our behalf or comply with legal requirements. Examples of these service providers include entities that verify information, fulfill orders, and provide web hosting, analytics, advertising and marketing services. These service providers may combine data we provide to them or allow them to collect from or about you with data they collect in connection with other websites, applications or services to measure the effectiveness of our advertising and determine how you use our Site and services.

We also may disclose information about you (i) if we are required to do so by law or legal process (such as a court order), (ii) in response to a request by law enforcement authorities, (iii) to enforce our Terms of Use or the terms of any of our statements or policies, or (iv) when we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to prevent physical harm or financial loss or in connection with an investigation of suspected or actual illegal activity. We also reserve the right to transfer personal information we have about you in the event we sell or transfer all or a portion of our business or assets (including in the event of a reorganization, dissolution or liquidation). Should such a sale or transfer occur, we will use reasonable efforts to direct the transferee to use personal information you have provided to us in a manner that is consistent with our then-current Privacy Statement. Following such a sale or transfer, you may contact the entity to which we transferred your personal information with any inquiries concerning the processing of that information.

We may also share, sell and transfer aggregated, anonymized information for any purpose, except where applicable law requires otherwise.

Your Rights and Choices

We offer you certain choices in connection with the personal information we collect about you, such as how we use the information and how we communicate with you. To update your preferences, ask us to remove your information from our mailing lists, exercise your rights or submit a request, please contact us as indicated in the âHow to Contact Usâ section of this Privacy Statement. You can also unsubscribe from our mailing lists by following the âUnsubscribeâ link in our emails. To the extent provided by law, you may request access to the personal information we maintain about you or request that we correct, amend, delete or block the information by contacting us as indicated in the âHow to Contact Usâ section of this Privacy Statement. Where provided by law, you may withdraw any consent you previously provided to us or object at any time on legitimate grounds to the processing of your personal information, and we will apply your verified preferences within a commercially reasonable thereafter going forward.

Widgets, Buttons, and Tools

Our Site may include widgets, buttons or tools which are interactive mini-programs that run on our Site to provide specific services from another company (e.g., links to bookmarked sites or allowing you to share a profile with your Facebook or Twitter account or the content of the Site to be commented upon and shared within a social media platform, or use a crypto wallet), along with buttons or other tools that link to other companies' services (e.g., a "Like" button or third-party map). The widget, button or tool may collect and automatically send personal information, such as your e-mail address, or other information (such as your browser information, or IP address), other payment information including crypto wallet information, to a third-party. Cookies may also be set or used by the widgets, buttons or tools to enable them to function properly or for other purposes, which may include advertising. Information collected or used by a widget, button or tool, including cookie settings and preferences, is governed by the privacy policy of the company that created it. We and all other members of the GHOSTWARP Parties have no responsibility or liability for the practices, policies and security measures implemented by such parties.

Information obtained by Google Analytics

This Site uses the Google Analytics web analysis service and enters into an agreement with Google as the data processor. Google Analytics stores a persistent cookie on your hard drive. The information in this cookie (including your IP address) is transmitted to Google and stored on Google servers. Google uses this information to anonymously analyze your use of the Site, compile reports on your Site activity for Site operators, and provide other services related to your Site activity and Internet usage. Google may transfer this information to third parties where required to do so by law or where those third parties process the information on Google's behalf. To our knowledge, Google will not associate your IP address with any other data held by Google.

By using this Site, you consent to Google's processing of data about you. For a review of Googleâs Privacy Policy please see https://policies.google.com/privacy. Â Please also see the section of our Cookie Notice which provides details and explains how to exercise certain of your choices.

Interest Based Advertising

We may collect information about your online activities on our Site to provide you with advertising about products and services tailored to your individual interests. We also may obtain information for this purpose from third-party websites on which our ads are served. Please see the section of our Cookie Notice which provides details and explains how to exercise certain of your choices.

Online Tracking and How We Respond to Do Not Track Signals

When you use our Site, both we and certain third parties (such as our advertising networks, digital advertising partners and social media platforms) may collect personal information about your online activities, over time and across third-party websites. Please see the section of our Cookie Notice which provides details and explains how our Site responds to DNT signals or similar mechanisms from browsers.

Newsletters

You may be able to sign up to receive newsletters about our products and services by submitting your e-mail address on this Site. If you use this feature, you provide your affirmative consent and agree to allow us to send you newsletters about our products, services and promotions to such e-mail address. You may, at any time, opt out of receiving these newsletters by contacting us as specified in the "How to Contact Us" section below.

Mobile Marketing

You may be able to sign up to receive communications about our products and services through your mobile device by submitting your mobile telephone number and/or mobile email address on this Site. If you use this feature, you provide your affirmative consent and agree to allow us to send you communications about our products, services and promotions to such email address and/or by text message and voice message. You may, at any time, opt out of receiving these communications by contacting us as specified in the "How to Contact Us" section below. Depending on the terms of your mobile phone contract, you may incur charges for receiving and sending email and text messages on your mobile device. ENDSTATE and all other members of the GHOSTWARP Parties are not responsible for these charges.

Services And Products On Other Websites

We may offer some of our products and services or authorized branding on or through other websites, apps and platforms. Information, including personally identifiable information, that you provide to those websites, apps and platforms may be sent to us in order to deliver our products and services or collected and used by us as described in this Privacy Statement. We process, use, share and secure such information under this Privacy Statement. The affiliated websites, apps and platforms through which our products and services and authorized branding are offered may have different privacy practices and we encourage you to read their privacy policies. We and all other members of the GHOSTWARP Parties have no responsibility or liability for the practices, policies and security measures implemented by third parties on their websites, apps and platforms.

Information Security

While we endeavor to protect the security and integrity of personal information collected via this Site, due to the inherent nature of the Internet as an open global communications vehicle, we cannot guarantee that any information, during transmission through the Internet or while stored on our or out third-party providersâ systems such as third-party hosted servers and vendor or sales platform application programing interfaces, or otherwise in our care, will be absolutely safe from intrusion by others, such as hackers. The safety and security of your personal data also depends on you. Where we have given you (or where you have chosen) a password for access to certain parts of our Site, you are responsible for keeping this password confidential. We ask you not to share your password with anyone. If you correspond with us by e-mail, text message, or using Web forms like a âcontact usâ feature on our Site, you should be aware that your transmission might not be secure. A third-party could view the information you send in transit by such means. We and all other members of the GHOSTWARP Parties will have no liability for disclosure or damage of your information due to errors or unauthorized acts of third parties. Â If we believe that the security of your personal information in our care may have been compromised, we may seek to notify you of that development. If a notification is appropriate, we will endeavor to notify you as promptly as possible under the circumstances. If we have your e-mail address, we may notify you by e-mail. You consent to our use of e-mail as a means of such notification. If you prefer for us to use the U.S. Postal Service to notify you in this situation, please e-mail us at legal@endstate.io.

Children

The Site is not directed to children under the age of thirteen and we do not knowingly collect personal information from children under the age of thirteen on the Site. If we become aware that we have inadvertently received personal information from a child under the age of thirteen on our Site, we will delete the information from our records; provided that such access is not unreasonably burdensome or expensive under the circumstances. We recommend that prospective users between the ages of 13 and 17 ask their parents or other legal guardians for permission before sending any information about themselves to anyone over the Internet. Â If a parent or guardian becomes aware that his or her child under the age of thirteen has provided us with information without their consent, he or she should contact us at legal@endstate.io. In addition, we reserve the right to limit participation in particular programs or promotions to visitors eighteen (18) years of age, twenty one (21) years of age, or older. Â

Data Integrity

ENDSTATE takes reasonable steps to ensure that personal information the company collects is relevant for the purposes for which it is to be used and that the information is reliable for its intended use and is accurate, complete and current. We depend on our Site visitors, registered users and customers to timely update and correct their personal information whenever necessary.

Public Forums

We may allow for the Services to permit you to: participate in interactive discussions; create a profile; post comments, opportunities or other content; communicate directly with another user; or otherwise engage in networking activities. Some of these services may be moderated and all may be accessed for technical or other reasons determined by GHOSTWARP in its sole discretion. Please be advised that GHOSTWARP does not control and assumes no liability for the content that users post to these forums or social networks. Therefore, you should carefully consider whether you wish to submit personal Information to these forums or social networks and whether you wish to make your profile available to other users, and you should tailor any content you submit appropriately. You should also review any additional terms and conditions that may govern your use of these services, including but not limited to, those from non-GHOSTWARP controlled services. To manage or remove your personal Information from our online communities, please contact us as indicated in the âHow To Contact Usâ section below. Â We cannot prevent such information from being used in a manner that may violate this Privacy Statement or applicable law.

How to Contact Us

If you would like us to update information we have about you or your preferences or if have any questions or comments about this Privacy Statement, please contact us by email at legal@endstate.io. Â You also may write to:

Legal Affairs

c/o GHOSTWARP

c/o ROTHWELL FIGG, attn. JESS M. COLLEN

The Holyoke-Manhattan Building

809 South Highland Avenue

Ossining, NEW YORK 10562 USA

Changes in Privacy Statement/Acknowledgment

We retain the right to change this Privacy Statement at any time and without prior notice to you to reflect changes in the GHOSTWARP personal information practices or relevant laws. If the changes are significant, we may provide a more prominent notice which may include email notification of Privacy Statement changes. The practices and policies contained in this Privacy Statement replace all previous notices or statements with respect to the same subject. Your access, use or interaction with us, our third-party providers or our Site following the posting of such changes or the updated Privacy Statement will constitute your affirmative consent to and acceptance of any such changes. You are responsible for ensuring we have an up-to-date active and deliverable email address for you, and for periodically visiting our Site(s) and this Privacy Statement to make sure that you understand how we collect, track, compile, use, transfer, secure and share information.

â

The information provided in this Privacy Statement cannot be interpreted as business, legal or other advice, or as warranting fail-proof security for information provided through this Site. Information provided on this Site is intended to allow the public access to information related to ENDSTATE. While all attempts are made to provide accurate, current and reliable information, there is possibility of human and/or mechanical error. This Privacy Statement is not intended to and does not create any contractual or other legal rights for or on behalf of any party.

Privacy Statement Effective Date: January 1, 2022

CopyrightÂ© 2022 by GHOSTWARP â all rights are reserved.

Last Updated: January, 2022

Cookie Notice

GHOSTWARP Corporation (âGHOSTWARPâ, âENDSTATEâ, "our", "we", or "us"), and our third-party providers may set and use cookies and similar technologies to store and manage user preferences, deliver targeted advertising, enable content, and gather analytic and usage data, for example. The use of cookies and other tracking technologies is standard within Web sites and apps through which information is collected about your online activities across applications, Web sites, or other services (âSiteâ). More information about how we use cookies and similar technologies and how you can control and manage them is below. By continuing to use our Site, you acknowledge that you have seen our notification requesting your consent to use cookies and similar technologies as set forth in this Cookie Notice and that you have indicated your cookie and similar technologies preferences through our notification tool. By continuing to browse the Site, you are agreeing to our use of these cookies and similar technologies. This Cookie Notice should be read in conjunction with our Online Privacy Statement and Terms of Use which govern access to our Site in general.

What is a cookie?

A cookie is a small text file that is placed on a computer or other device and is used to identify the user or device and to collect information. Cookies are typically assigned to one of four categories, depending on their function and intended purpose: absolutely necessary cookies, performance cookies, functional cookies, and cookies for marketing purposes.

Types of cookies and why we use them

Absolutely necessary cookies: These cookies are essential to enable you to move around a Website and use its features. Without these cookies, services you have asked for, like completing forms on our Site, cannot be provided.

Performance cookies: These cookies collect information about how you use our Site. Information collected includes, for example, the Internet browsers and operating systems used, the domain name of the Website previously visited, the number of visits, average duration of visit, and pages viewed. These cookies only collect information in an aggregated format. Performance cookies are used to improve the user-friendliness of the Website and enhance your experience.

Functionality cookies: These cookies allow the Website to remember choices you make (such as your username or ID, language preference, or the area or region you are in) and provide enhanced, more personal features. These cookies can also be used to remember changes you have made to text size, fonts, and other customizable parts of Web pages. They may also be used to provide services you have asked for, such as watching a video or commenting on a blog. These cookies cannot track your browsing activity on other Websites.

Targeting and advertising cookies: These cookies track browsing habits and are used to deliver targeted (interest-based) advertising. They are also used to limit the number of times you see an ad and to measure the effectiveness of advertising campaigns. They remember that you have visited the Website and this information is shared with other organizations, such as advertisers.

Managing cookies

You can manage Website cookies in your browser settings, and you always have the choice to change these settings by accepting, rejecting, or deleting cookies. If you choose to change your settings, you may find that certain functions and features will not work as intended on our Site. All browser settings are slightly different, so to manage cookies, you should refer to the relevant settings within your browser.

We understand that you may want to know more about cookies. Here are some useful resources that provide detailed information about types of cookies, how they are used, and how you can manage your cookie preferences: www.aboutcookies.org Â or www.allaboutcookies.org. Please click below for detailed information on how to disable and delete cookies in some commonly used browsers:

We may use certain other tracking technologies in addition to cookies

Local shared objects/Flash cookies: Flash cookies, also known as local shared objects, are designed to support browser content supported by AdobeÂ® Flash. They are usually used to enable ads and video content on Websites. Like other cookies, they will store information on your device, some of which will be specific to the Flash-enabled content. Flash cookies can only be deleted within Adobe Flash rather than via your browser. Please refer to the following help page for information on how to manage your privacy settings and deletion of Flash cookies:

Web beacons: Our Site may contain electronic images known as web beacons (also called single-pixel gifs and transparent graphic images) that we use to help deliver cookies on our Site, count users who have visited our Site, deliver services, and analyze the effectiveness of our promotional campaigns, for example. We may also include web beacons in our marketing email messages to determine whether an email is opened or if links are clicked. Web beacons are also used to deliver you interest based advertising (discussed in more detail at the end of this Cookie Notice).

â

Web server & application logs: Our servers automatically collect certain information to help us administer and protect the Site, analyze usage, and improve usersâ experience. The information collected includes:

IP address and browser type

Device information including Unique Device Identifier (UDID), MAC address, Identifier For Advertisers (IFA), and similar identifiers we or others may assign

Device operating system and other technical facts

The city, state, and country from which you access our Site

Pages visited and content viewed, stored, and ordered

Information or text entered

Links and buttons clicked

URLs visited before and after you use our Site

Web Analytics Services

This Site uses the Google Analytics web analysis service and enters into an agreement with Google as the data processor. Google Analytics stores a persistent cookie on your hard drive. The information in this cookie (including your IP address) is transmitted to Google and stored on Google servers. Google uses this information to anonymously analyze your use of the Site, compile reports on your Site activity for Site operators, and provide other services related to your Site activity and Internet usage. Google may transfer this information to third parties where required to do so by law or where those third parties process the information on Google's behalf. To our knowledge, Google will not associate your IP address with any other data held by Google. By using this Site, you consent to Google's processing of data about you. For a review of Googleâs Privacy Policy please see https://policies.google.com/privacy. You can opt out of aggregation and analysis of data collected by Google Analytics at https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout.

Location Based Services

We and our service providers may collect, use, and share the physical location of your device and use it to provide you with personalized location-based services or content. Where available, location-based services may use GPS, Bluetooth, and your IP Address, along with crowd-sourced Wi-Fi hotspot and cell tower locations, and other technologies to determine your deviceâs approximate location. In some instances, you may be permitted to allow or deny such use of your device's location, but if you choose to deny such use, we may not be able to provide you with the applicable personalized services or content.

âDo Not Trackâ Signals

Some browsers transmit Do Not Track (DNT) signals to Websites. Due to the lack of a common interpretation of DNT signals throughout the industry, we do not currently alter, change, or respond to DNT requests or signals from these browsers.
